data.name: Label-pool.ha_host_failures_to_tolerate
data.value: Number of server failures to tolerate

data.name: Description-Bond.slaves
data.value: The interfaces which are part of this bond

data.name: Description-PBD.SR
data.value: the storage repository that the pbd realises

data.name: Description-PBD.currently_attached
data.value: is the SR currently attached on this host?

data.name: Description-PBD.device_config
data.value: a config string to string map that is provided to the host's SR-backend-driver

data.name: Description-PBD.host
data.value: physical machine on which the pbd is available

data.name: Description-PIF.DNS
data.value: IP address of DNS servers to use

data.name: Description-PIF.MAC
data.value: ethernet MAC address of physical interface

data.name: Description-PIF.VLAN
data.value: VLAN tag for all traffic passing through this interface

data.name: Description-PIF.VLAN_master_of
data.value: indicates wich VLAN this interface receives untagged traffic from

data.name: Description-PIF.VLAN_slave_of
data.value: indicates which VLANs this interface transmits tagged traffic to

data.name: Description-PIF.bond_master_of
data.value: indicates this PIF represents the results of a bond

data.name: Description-PIF.bond_slave_of
data.value: indicates which bond this interface is part of

data.name: Description-PIF.currently_attached
data.value: true if this interface is online

data.name: Description-PIF.device
data.value: machine-readable name of the interface (e.g. eth0)

data.name: Description-PIF.disallow_unplug
data.value: prevent this PIF from being unplugged; set this to notify the management tool-stack that the PIF has a special use and should not be unplugged under any circumstances (e.g. because you're running storage traffic over it)

data.name: Description-PIF.host
data.value: physical machine to which this pif is connected

data.name: Description-PIF.ip_configuration_mode
data.value: Sets if and how this interface gets an IP address

data.name: Description-PIF.management
data.value: indicates whether the control software is listening for connections on this interface

data.name: Description-PIF.network
data.value: virtual network to which this pif is connected

data.name: Description-PIF.physical
data.value: true if this represents a physical network interface

data.name: Description-PIF_metrics.carrier
data.value: Report if the PIF got a carrier or not

data.name: Description-PIF_metrics.duplex
data.value: Full duplex capability of the link (if available)

data.name: Description-PIF_metrics.last_updated
data.value: Time at which this information was last updated

data.name: Description-PIF_metrics.pci_bus_path
data.value: PCI bus path of the pif (if available)

data.name: Description-SM.configuration
data.value: names and descriptions of device config keys

data.name: Description-SM.copyright
data.value: Entity which owns the copyright of this plugin

data.name: Description-SM.name_description
data.value: a notes field containg human-readable description

data.name: Description-SM.required_api_version
data.value: Minimum SM API version required on the server

data.name: Description-SR.allowed_operations
data.value: list of the operations allowed in this state

data.name: Description-SR.blobs
data.value: Binary blobs associated with this SR

data.name: Description-SR.content_type
data.value: the type of the SR's content, if required (e.g. ISOs)

data.name: Description-SR.current_operations
data.value: Map of task reference to current operation enumeration

data.name: Description-SR.name_description
data.value: This Storage Repository's description, yours to edit

data.name: Description-SR.name_label
data.value: This Storage Repository's name, yours to edit

data.name: Description-SR.physical_size
data.value: total physical size of the repository (in bytes)

data.name: Description-SR.physical_utilisation
data.value: physical space currently utilised on this storage repository (in bytes). Note that for sparse disk formats, physical_utilisation may be less than virtual_allocation

data.name: Description-SR.shared
data.value: true if this SR is (capable of being) shared between multiple hosts

data.name: Description-SR.virtual_allocation
data.value: sum of virtual_sizes of all VDIs in this storage repository (in bytes)

data.name: Description-VBD.allowed_operations
data.value: list of the operations allowed in this state

data.name: Description-VBD.bootable
data.value: true if this VBD is bootable

data.name: Description-VBD.current_operations
data.value: Map of task reference to current operation enumeration

data.name: Description-VBD.currently_attached
data.value: is the device currently attached (erased on reboot)

data.name: Description-VBD.device
data.value: device seen by the guest e.g. hda1

data.name: Description-VBD.empty
data.value: if true this represents an empty drive

data.name: Description-VBD.mode
data.value: the mode the VBD should be mounted with

data.name: Description-VBD.qos_supported_algorithms
data.value: supported QoS algorithms for this VBD

data.name: Description-VBD.status_code
data.value: error/success code associated with last attach-operation (erased on reboot)

data.name: Description-VBD.status_detail
data.value: error/success information associated with last attach-operation status (erased on reboot)

data.name: Description-VBD.storage_lock
data.value: true if a storage level lock was acquired

data.name: Description-VBD.type
data.value: how the VBD will appear to the guest (e.g. disk or CD)

data.name: Description-VBD.unpluggable
data.value: true if this VBD will support hot-unplug

data.name: Description-VBD_metrics.last_updated
data.value: Time at which this information was last updated

data.name: Description-VDI.SR
data.value: storage repository in which the VDI resides

data.name: Description-VDI.VBDs
data.value: list of vbds that refer to this disk

data.name: Description-VDI.allowed_operations
data.value: list of the operations allowed in this state

data.name: Description-VDI.crash_dumps
data.value: list of crash dumps that refer to this disk

data.name: Description-VDI.current_operations
data.value: Map of task reference to current operation enumeration

data.name: Description-VDI.is_a_snapshot
data.value: true if this is a snapshot.

data.name: Description-VDI.missing
data.value: true if SR scan operation reported this VDI as not present on disk

data.name: Description-VDI.name_description
data.value: This virtual disk's description, yours to edit

data.name: Description-VDI.name_label
data.value: This virtual disk's name, yours to edit

data.name: Description-VDI.parent
data.value: References the parent disk, if this VDI is part of a chain

data.name: Description-VDI.physical_utilisation
data.value: amount of physical space that the disk image is currently taking up on the storage repository (in bytes)

data.name: Description-VDI.read_only
data.value: true if this disk may ONLY be mounted read-only

data.name: Description-VDI.sharable
data.value: true if this disk may be shared

data.name: Description-VDI.snapshot_of
data.value: Ref pointing to the VDI this snapshot is of.

data.name: Description-VDI.snapshot_time
data.value: Date/time when this snapshot was created.

data.name: Description-VDI.snapshots
data.value: List pointing to all the VDIs snapshots.

data.name: Description-VDI.storage_lock
data.value: true if this disk is locked at the storage level

data.name: Description-VDI.virtual_size
data.value: size of disk as presented to the guest (in bytes). Note that, depending on storage backend type, requested size may not be respected exactly

data.name: Description-VDI.xenstore_data
data.value: data to be inserted into the xenstore tree (/local/domain/0/backend/vbd/<domid>/<device-id>/sm-data) after the VDI is attached. This is generally set by the SM backends on vdi_attach.

data.name: Description-VIF.MAC
data.value: ethernet MAC address of virtual interface, as exposed to guest

data.name: Description-VIF.VM
data.value: virtual machine to which this vif is connected

data.name: Description-VIF.allowed_operations
data.value: list of the operations allowed in this state

data.name: Description-VIF.current_operations
data.value: Map of task reference to current operation enumeration

data.name: Description-VIF.currently_attached
data.value: is the device currently attached (erased on reboot)

data.name: Description-VIF.device
data.value: name of network device as exposed to guest e.g. eth0

data.name: Description-VIF.network
data.value: virtual network to which this vif is connected

data.name: Description-VIF.qos_supported_algorithms
data.value: supported QoS algorithms for this VIF

data.name: Description-VIF.status_code
data.value: error/success code associated with last attach-operation (erased on reboot)

data.name: Description-VIF.status_detail
data.value: error/success information associated with last attach-operation status (erased on reboot)

data.name: Description-VIF_metrics.last_updated
data.value: Time at which this information was last updated

data.name: Description-VLAN.tagged_PIF
data.value: interface on which traffic is tagged

data.name: Description-VLAN.untagged_PIF
data.value: interface on which traffic is untagged

data.name: Description-VM.HVM_shadow_multiplier
data.value: multiplier applied to the amount of shadow that will be made available to the guest

data.name: Description-VM.PCI_bus
data.value: PCI bus path for pass-through devices

data.name: Description-VM.PV_args
data.value: Kernel command-line arguments for this VM (advanced use only)

data.name: Description-VM.PV_bootloader
data.value: name of or path to bootloader

data.name: Description-VM.VCPUs
data.value: The number of virtual CPUs assigned to the VM

data.name: Description-VM.VCPUs_max
data.value: The number of virtual CPUs assigned to the selected VM

data.name: Description-VM.VCPUs_params
data.value: configuration parameters for the selected VCPU policy

data.name: Description-VM.actions_after_crash
data.value: action to take if the guest crashes

data.name: Description-VM.actions_after_reboot
data.value: action to take after the guest has rebooted itself

data.name: Description-VM.actions_after_shutdown
data.value: action to take after the guest has shutdown itself

data.name: Description-VM.affinity
data.value: a host which the VM has some affinity for (or NULL). This is used as a hint to the start call when it decides where to run the VM. Implementations are free to ignore this field.

data.name: Description-VM.allowed_operations
data.value: list of the VM operations allowed in this state

data.name: Description-VM.blobs
data.value: Binary blobs associated with this VM

data.name: Description-VM.blocked_operations
data.value: List of operations which have been explicitly blocked and an error code

data.name: Description-VM.crash_dumps
data.value: crash dumps associated with this VM

data.name: Description-VM.current_operations
data.value: Map of task reference to current operation enumeration

data.name: Description-VM.domarch
data.value: Domain architecture (if available, null string otherwise)

data.name: Description-VM.guest_metrics
data.value: metrics associated with the running guest

data.name: Description-VM.ha_always_run
data.value: if true then the system will attempt to keep the VM running as much as possible.

data.name: Description-VM.ha_restart_priority
data.value: Only defined if ha_always_run is set possible values: "best-effort" meaning "try to restart this VM if possible but don't consider the Pool to be overcommitted if this is not possible"; and a numerical restart priority (e.g. 1, 2, 3,...)

data.name: Description-VM.is_a_snapshot
data.value: true if this is a snapshot. Snapshotted VMs can never be started, they are used only for cloning other VMs

data.name: Description-VM.is_a_template
data.value: true if this is a template. Template VMs can never be started, they are used only for cloning other VMs

data.name: Description-VM.is_control_domain
data.value: true if this is a control domain (domain 0 or a driver domain)

data.name: Description-VM.last_boot_CPU_flags
data.value: describes the CPU flags on which the VM was last booted

data.name: Description-VM.last_booted_record
data.value: marshalled value containing VM record at time of last boot, updated dynamically to reflect the runtime state of the domain

data.name: Description-VM.memory_target
data.value: Dynamically-set memory target (bytes). The value of this field indicates the current target for memory available to this VM.

data.name: Description-VM.name_description
data.value: This VM's description, yours to edit

data.name: Description-VM.name_label
data.value: This VM's name, yours to edit

data.name: Description-VM.power_state
data.value: Current power state of the machine

data.name: Description-VM.recommendations
data.value: An XML specification of recommended values and ranges for properties of this VM

data.name: Description-VM.resident_on
data.value: the host the VM is currently resident on

data.name: Description-VM.snapshot_of
data.value: Ref pointing to the VM this snapshot is of.

data.name: Description-VM.snapshot_time
data.value: Date/time when this snapshot was created.

data.name: Description-VM.snapshots
data.value: List pointing to all the VM snapshots.

data.name: Description-VM.suspend_VDI
data.value: The VDI that a suspend image is stored on. (Only has meaning if VM is currently suspended)

data.name: Description-VM.transportable_snapshot_id
data.value: Transportable ID of the snapshot VM

data.name: Description-VM.user_version
data.value: a user version number for this machine

data.name: Description-VM.xenstore_data
data.value: data to be inserted into the xenstore tree (/local/domain/<domid>/vm-data) after the VM is created.

data.name: Description-VM_guest_metrics.PV_drivers_up_to_date
data.value: true if the PV drivers appear to be up to date

data.name: Description-VM_guest_metrics.last_updated
data.value: Time at which this information was last updated

data.name: Description-VM_guest_metrics.live
data.value: True if the guest is sending heartbeat messages via the guest agent

data.name: Description-VM_metrics.VCPUs_utilisation
data.value: Utilisation for all of guest's current VCPUs

data.name: Description-VM_metrics.install_time
data.value: Time at which the VM was installed

data.name: Description-VM_metrics.last_updated
data.value: Time at which this information was last updated

data.name: Description-VM_metrics.start_time
data.value: Time at which this VM was last booted

data.name: Description-VM_metrics.state
data.value: The state of the guest, eg blocked, dying etc

data.name: Description-VTPM.backend
data.value: the domain where the backend is located

data.name: Description-blob.last_updated
data.value: Time at which the data in the blob was last updated

data.name: Description-blob.mime_type
data.value: The mime type associated with this object. Defaults to 'application/octet-stream' if the empty string is supplied

data.name: Description-blob.name_description
data.value: a notes field containg human-readable description

data.name: Description-blob.size
data.value: Size of the binary data, in bytes

data.name: Description-console.VM
data.value: VM to which this console is attached

data.name: Description-console.protocol
data.value: the protocol used by this console

data.name: Description-data_source.enabled
data.value: true if the data source is being logged

data.name: Description-data_source.max
data.value: the maximum value of the data source

data.name: Description-data_source.min
data.value: the minimum value of the data source

data.name: Description-data_source.name_description
data.value: a notes field containg human-readable description

data.name: Description-data_source.standard
data.value: true if the data source is enabled by default. Non-default data sources cannot be disabled

data.name: Description-data_source.value
data.value: current value of the data source

data.name: Description-event.class
data.value: The name of the class of the object that changed

data.name: Description-event.id
data.value: An ID, monotonically increasing, and local to the current session

data.name: Description-event.obj_uuid
data.value: The uuid of the object that changed

data.name: Description-event.ref
data.value: A reference to the object that changed

data.name: Description-event.timestamp
data.value: The time at which the event occurred

data.name: Description-host.address
data.value: The address by which this host can be contacted from any other host in the pool

data.name: Description-host.allowed_operations
data.value: list of the operations allowed in this state

data.name: Description-host.blobs
data.value: Binary blobs associated with this host

data.name: Description-host.cpu_configuration
data.value: The CPU configuration on this host. May contain keys such as "nr_nodes", "sockets_per_node", "cores_per_socket", or "threads_per_core"

data.name: Description-host.crash_dump_sr
data.value: The SR in which VDIs for crash dumps are created

data.name: Description-host.current_operations
data.value: Map of task reference to current operation enumeration

data.name: Description-host.enabled
data.value: True if the host is currently enabled

data.name: Description-host.ha_network_peers
data.value: The set of hosts visible via the network from this host

data.name: Description-host.ha_statefiles
data.value: The set of statefiles accessible from this host

data.name: Description-host.host_CPUs
data.value: The physical CPUs on this host

data.name: Description-host.license_params
data.value: The key/value pairs read from the license file

data.name: Description-host.name_description
data.value: This host's description, yours to edit

data.name: Description-host.name_label
data.value: This host's name, yours to edit

data.name: Description-host.resident_VMs
data.value: list of VMs currently resident on host

data.name: Description-host.sched_policy
data.value: Scheduler policy currently in force on this host

data.name: Description-host.software_version
data.value: The version details provided by the host

data.name: Description-host.supported_bootloaders
data.value: a list of the bootloaders installed on the machine

data.name: Description-host.suspend_image_sr
data.value: The SR in which VDIs for suspend images are created

data.name: Description-host.system_status-X11
data.value: Log files from the X server

data.name: Description-host.system_status-boot-loader
data.value: List of boot options and their details given to the user at system boot time

data.name: Description-host.system_status-disk-info
data.value: Partition tables, free space, iSCSI and LVM configuration

data.name: Description-host.system_status-firstboot
data.value: The scripts run for initializing local storage repositories and networking

data.name: Description-host.system_status-hardware-info
data.value: Details of the processors, memory and other basic hardware

data.name: Description-host.system_status-hdparm-t
data.value: Performs a number of timing tests on each local hard disk, these may take up to one minute to complete

data.name: Description-host.system_status-host-crashdump-dumps
data.value: Memory dump created on server crash, if you select this option you will be prompted for these files to be removed after the report has been compiled

data.name: Description-host.system_status-host-crashdump-logs
data.value: Log files generated at time of server crash

data.name: Description-host.system_status-kernel-info
data.value: Details of kernel modules, filesystems devices and kernel configuration

data.name: Description-host.system_status-network-config
data.value: Configuration files used to bring up network interfaces, provide name resolution and enable the firewall

data.name: Description-host.system_status-network-status
data.value: Current status of the network interfaces, routing tables and firewall

data.name: Description-host.system_status-persistent-stats
data.value: This enables collection of RRD performance data stored in dom0

data.name: Description-host.system_status-process-list
data.value: A complete listing of the processes running in a tree format

data.name: Description-host.system_status-system-logs
data.value: Logfiles which record the activity of various system processes

data.name: Description-host.system_status-xen-info
data.value: Details of the hypervisor version and it's current state

data.name: Description-host.system_status-xenserver-config
data.value: Details of the XenServer such as version and build information, primary hard disk location and pool configuration

data.name: Description-host.system_status-xenserver-databases
data.value: The database which stores the state of the XenServer

data.name: Description-host.system_status-xenserver-domains
data.value: List of the guest VMs installed onto the server and their current states

data.name: Description-host.system_status-xenserver-install
data.value: Log files generated during the installation of the XenServer

data.name: Description-host.system_status-xenserver-logs
data.value: Log files concerning the XenServer's activity

data.name: Description-host.system_status-xha-liveset
data.value: The details of HA host that are alive

data.name: Description-host.system_status-yum
data.value: YUM repository information and RPM package database listing

data.name: Description-host_cpu.family
data.value: the family (number) of the physical CPU

data.name: Description-host_cpu.flags
data.value: the flags of the physical CPU (a decoded version of the features field)

data.name: Description-host_cpu.host
data.value: the host the CPU is in

data.name: Description-host_cpu.model
data.value: the model number of the physical CPU

data.name: Description-host_cpu.modelname
data.value: the model name of the physical CPU

data.name: Description-host_cpu.number
data.value: the number of the physical CPU within the host

data.name: Description-host_cpu.speed
data.value: the speed of the physical CPU

data.name: Description-host_cpu.stepping
data.value: the stepping of the physical CPU

data.name: Description-host_cpu.vendor
data.value: the vendor of the physical CPU

data.name: Description-host_metrics.last_updated
data.value: Time at which this information was last updated

data.name: Description-host_metrics.live
data.value: Pool master thinks this host is live

data.name: Description-host_patch.applied
data.value: True if the patch has been applied

data.name: Description-host_patch.name_description
data.value: a notes field containing human-readable description

data.name: Description-message.cls
data.value: The class of the object this message is associated with

data.name: Description-message.obj_uuid
data.value: The uuid of the object this message is associated with

data.name: Description-message.priority
data.value: The message priority, 0 being low priority

data.name: Description-message.timestamp
data.value: The time at which the message was created

data.name: Description-network.allowed_operations
data.value: list of the operations allowed in this state

data.name: Description-network.blobs
data.value: Binary blobs associated with this network

data.name: Description-network.bridge
data.value: name of the bridge corresponding to this network on the local host

data.name: Description-network.current_operations
data.value: Map of task reference to current operation enumeration

data.name: Description-network.name_description
data.value: This network's description, yours to edit

data.name: Description-network.name_label
data.value: This network's name, yours to edit

data.name: Description-pool.blobs
data.value: Binary blobs associated with this pool

data.name: Description-pool.crash_dump_SR
data.value: The SR in which VDIs for crash dumps are created

data.name: Description-pool.ha_allow_overcommit
data.value: If set to false then operations which would cause the Pool to become overcommitted will be blocked.

data.name: Description-pool.ha_enabled
data.value: true if HA is enabled on the pool, false otherwise

data.name: Description-pool.ha_host_failures_to_tolerate
data.value: Number of host failures to tolerate before the Pool is declared to be overcommitted

data.name: Description-pool.ha_overcommitted
data.value: True if the Pool is considered to be overcommitted i.e. if there exist insufficient physical resources to tolerate the configured number of host failures

data.name: Description-pool.ha_plan_exists_for
data.value: Number of future host failures we have managed to find a plan for. Once this reaches zero any future host failures will cause the failure of protected VMs.

data.name: Description-pool.master
data.value: The host that is pool master

data.name: Description-pool.name_description
data.value: This pool's description, yours to edit

data.name: Description-pool.name_label
data.value: This pool's name, yours to edit

data.name: Description-pool.suspend_image_SR
data.value: The SR in which VDIs for suspend images are created

data.name: Description-pool_patch.after_apply_guidance
data.value: What the client should do after this patch has been applied.

data.name: Description-pool_patch.host_patches
data.value: This hosts this patch is applied to.

data.name: Description-pool_patch.name_description
data.value: a notes field containing human-readable description

data.name: Description-pool_patch.pool_applied
data.value: This patch should be applied across the entire pool

data.name: Description-session.last_active
data.value: Timestamp for last time session was active

data.name: Description-session.pool
data.value: True if this session relates to a intra-pool login, false otherwise

data.name: Description-task.current_operations
data.value: Map of task reference to current operation enumeration

data.name: Description-task.error_info
data.value: if the task has failed, this field contains the set of associated error strings. Undefined otherwise.

data.name: Description-task.finished
data.value: Time task finished (i.e. succeeded or failed). If task-status is pending, then the value of this field has no meaning

data.name: Description-task.name_description
data.value: a notes field containg human-readable description

data.name: Description-task.progress
data.value: if the task is still pending, this field contains the estimated percentage complete (0-100). If task has completed (successfully or unsuccessfully) this should be 100.

data.name: Description-task.resident_on
data.value: the host on which the task is running

data.name: Description-task.result
data.value: if the task has completed successfully, this field contains the result value (either Void or an object reference). Undefined otherwise.

data.name: Description-task.subtask_of
data.value: Ref pointing to the task this is a substask of.

data.name: Description-task.subtasks
data.value: List pointing to all the substasks.

data.name: Description-task.type
data.value: if the task has completed successfully, this field contains the type of the encoded result (i.e. name of the class whose reference is in the result field). Undefined otherwise.

data.name: VM.TemplateDescription-CentOS 4.5
data.value: Installs CentOS 4.5 from vendor media or from a network installation server.

data.name: VM.TemplateDescription-CentOS 4.6
data.value: Installs CentOS 4.6 from vendor media or from a network installation server.

data.name: VM.TemplateDescription-CentOS 5.0
data.value: Installs CentOS 5.0 32-bit from vendor media or from a network installation server.

data.name: VM.TemplateDescription-CentOS 5.0 x64
data.value: Installs CentOS 5.0 64-bit from vendor media or from a network installation server.

data.name: VM.TemplateDescription-CentOS 5.1
data.value: Installs CentOS 5.1 32-bit from vendor media or from a network installation server.

data.name: VM.TemplateDescription-CentOS 5.1 x64
data.value: Installs CentOS 5.1 64-bit from vendor media or from a network installation server.

data.name: VM.TemplateDescription-Citrix XenApp
data.value: Installs Windows Server 2003 32-bit, optimized for installation of Citrix XenApp.

data.name: VM.TemplateDescription-Citrix XenApp x64
data.value: Installs Windows Server 2003 64-bit, optimized for installation of Citrix XenApp.

data.name: VM.TemplateDescription-Debian Etch 4.0
data.value: Installs a ready-to-use installation of Debian Etch 4.0.

data.name: VM.TemplateDescription-Debian Sarge 3.1
data.value: Installs a ready-to-use installation of Debian Sarge 3.1.

data.name: VM.TemplateDescription-Oracle Enterprise Linux 5.0

data.name: VM.TemplateDescription-Other install media
data.value: If the operating system you plan to use is not listed, you may be able to install it by selecting this template. We recommend that only advanced users attempt to use this template, and you should note that our products have been tested running only the supported distributions and specific versions covered by the standard supplied templates.

data.name: VM.TemplateDescription-Windows 2000 SP4
data.value: Installs Windows 2000 Server Service Pack 4. Earlier service packs are not supported.

data.name: VM.TemplateDescription-Windows Server 2003
data.value: Installs Windows Server 2003 32-bit Service Pack 0, 1, or 2. The Server, Enterprise, Data Centre, and SBS editions are supported.

data.name: VM.TemplateDescription-Windows Server 2003 x64
data.value: Installs Windows Server 2003 64-bit. The Server, Enterprise, Data Centre, and SBS Editions are supported.

data.name: VM.TemplateDescription-Windows XP SP2
data.value: Installs Windows XP Service Pack 2. Earlier service packs are not supported.

data.name: Message.body-ha_heartbeat_approaching_timeout
data.value: Server '{0}' is taking too long to respond to the HA networking heartbeat and may fence.

data.name: Message.body-ha_host_was_fenced
data.value: Server '{0}' could not be contacted and has been fenced

data.name: Message.body-ha_network_bonding_error
data.value: Network bond '{0}' on pool '{1}' has failed, limiting the HA failover capabilities on this pool.

data.name: Message.body-ha_pool_overcommitted
data.value: The maximum number of server failures tolerable in pool '{0}' has fallen below the requested value

data.name: Message.body-ha_protected_vm_restart_failed
data.value: The maximum number of server failures tolerable in pool '{0}' has fallen below the requested value

data.name: Message.body-ha_statefile_approaching_timeout
data.value: Server '{0}' is taking too long to write to the heartbeat storage and may fence.

data.name: Message.body-ha_statefile_lost
data.value: HA statefile on Storage Repository '{0}' in pool '{1}' has been lost. The pool's HA failover functionality is greatly reduced without a statefile.

data.name: Message.body-ha_xapi_healthcheck_approaching_timeout
data.value: XenServer on server '{0}' is taking too long to respond and may fence.

data.name: Message.body-host_clock_skew_detected
data.value: Server '{0}' may have a significantly different clock time compared to other servers in pool '{1}'. This may lead to errors when migrating VMs.

data.name: Message.body-host_sync_data_failed
data.value: Database synchronization on server '{0}' failed. Data may be lost if this server is switched off.

data.name: Message.body-license_does_not_support_pooling
data.value: Server '{0}' is unable to become a member of a pool as it does not have the correct license

data.name: Message.body-pbd_plug_failed_on_server_start
data.value: Storage repository '{0}' on server '{1}' failed to be attached when the server started. Try the Repair Storage option in the Storage menu.

data.name: Message.body-pool_master_transition
data.value: Server '{0}' is now the master of pool '{1}'. Connect to the pool through this server from now on.

data.name: Message.body-vbd_qos_failed
data.value: QoS settings for disk '{0}' on vm '{1}' could not be obeyed.

data.name: Message.body-vcpu_qos_failed
data.value: QoS settings for VCPU '{0}' on vm '{1}' could not be obeyed.

data.name: Message.body-vif_qos_failed
data.value: QoS settings for network interface '{0}' on vm '{1}' could not be obeyed.

data.name: Message.body-vm_shutdown
data.value: VM '{0}' was shut down successfully at {1}

data.name: Message.name-ha_protected_vm_restart_failed
data.value: HA Protected VM Failed to Restart

data.name: Message.name-pbd_plug_failed_on_server_start
data.value: Failed to Attach Storage on Server Boot
